meanings.definition: In a manner showing extreme anger or rage.
meanings.sent1: She stomped furiously out of the room after the argument.
meanings.sent2: The dog barked furiously at the mailman approaching the house.
meanings.sent3: The toddler furiously threw his toys around the room in a tantrum.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered furiously, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: Her heart beat furiously as she confronted the bully.

meanings.definition: In a manner showing intense speed or activity.
meanings.sent1: The athlete ran furiously towards the finish line, determined to win.
meanings.sent2: The wind howled furiously through the trees during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The students furiously scribbled down notes during the fast-paced lecture.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed furiously after the heavy rainfall, carrying debris along.
meanings.sent5: The workers furiously painted the walls to meet the deadline.
